intro: Bellis hortensis, commonly known as the garden chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-20 cm and features basal leaves that are spoon-shaped and hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and rock gardens. Bellis hortensis is also known for its mild scent and historical use in herbal medicine.
